main event: On 26 April 1954, an unidentified object was recovered at RAF Station Mildenhall, England, observed by personnel in the area. The object was described as approximately five feet in diameter, weighing approximately six ounces, with fabric of a pale yellow color. It had a sphere attached to it and landed in a tree line near the Air Installations Section.
interesting points: The recovered object was approximately five feet in diameter and weighed only six ounces.
Attached to the object was a sphere of approximately five feet by five feet, suspended by pieces of binders twine.
No identifying markings were noted on the sphere or the object.
Cognizance was assumed by the United Kingdom in an attempt to have the object identified.
The object was first seen at approximately 1600 hours on 26 April 1954 and landed near the Air Installations Section.
result: The recovered object was determined to be experimental flares launched from a United States ship participating in exercises in the North Sea area. It was not an unidentified aerial object, but rather a known military activity.
sighted object: Unidentified object recovered at RAF Station Mildenhall, England
witnesses: Personnel in the area and Assistant Provost Marshal of the 3910th Air Base Group, RAF Station Mildenhall
